snippet: A judge had ordered the government to turn over classified details to defense lawyers regarding the C.I.A.’s treatment of a Saudi detainee accused of planning the 2000 bombing of the destroyer Cole.
abstract: Brig Gen Mark S Martins, chief prosecutor at Guantanamo Bay war-crimes court, asks judge to set aside order requiring government to give defense lawyers classified details regarding Central Intelligence Agency's treatment of Saudi detainee Abd al-Rahim al0-Nashiri; he is accused of orchestrating 2000 bombing of destroyer Cole.
lead_paragraph: A judge had ordered the government to turn over classified details to defense lawyers regarding the C.I.A.’s treatment of a Saudi detainee accused of planning the 2000 bombing of the destroyer Cole.

headline.main: Guantánamo Prosecutor Fights Handing Secrets Over to Defense
headline.print_headline: Guantánamo Prosecutor Fights Handing Secrets Over to Defense
